name: Yoav Shemer-Kunz
goal:
Connecting European and Israeli policy-makers on the basis of the full implementation of Article 2 of the EU-Israel Association Agreement, that is, respect for human rights and democratic principles.

I provide European decision-makers with up-to-date information, knowledge, legal expertise and political analysis on Knesset legislation, Israeli policies and the current situation in Israel and Palestine, in particular on the situation of the Arab Palestinian citizens of Israel.

Article 2 of the EU-Israel Association Agreement of 1995 stipulates the following:

"Relations between the parties, as well as all the provisions of the Agreement itself, shall be based on respect for human rights and democratic principles, which guides their internal and international policy and constitutes an essential element of this Agreement."

This advocacy activity is an answer to the growing need felt by Israeli Human Rights NGOs and opposition Members of the Knesset for more strategic, coherent, systematic and permanent international advocacy activities in Europe on the situation in Israel and Palestine, based on expertise in EU politics and experience in EU advocacy and EU lobbying.

This activity is the answer of the Israeli civil society to the government's growing attempt to target NGOs and citizens who speak out against the government's policies and anti-democratic legislation and to the shrinking space of civil society in Israel.

My work allows an effective coordination of the often sporadic and ad-hoc advocacy activities taking place by Israeli NGOs or Members of the Knesset, hence empowering the Israeli civil society and the opposition, giving it an effective and permanent voice in Europe.
interests: European Neighbourhood Policy, Foreign affairs and security policy, International co-operation and development, Trade
